title: Large compile times with repetitive trait bound

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: I-compiletime
labels.description: Problems and improvements with respect to compile times.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: E-needs-mcve
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs a Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example

body:
I am using wundergraph that generate lot of macro code and it seems rustc have hard time resolving code [here](https://github.com/weiznich/wundergraph/blob/8bc544f278e97dcd94ac87b755fe2b60100de18e/wundergraph/src/macros/query.rs#L212-L273) and [here](https://github.com/weiznich/wundergraph/blob/8bc544f278e97dcd94ac87b755fe2b60100de18e/wundergraph/src/macros/mutation.rs#L494-L531) 

I tried this code:
https://github.com/Farkal/test-wundergraph

I expected to see this happen: 
Less than 40sc of compilation on each change

Instead, this happened:
40sc or more of compilation

## Meta

`rustc --version --verbose`:
rustc 1.41.0 (5e1a79984 2020-01-27)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 5e1a799842ba6ed4a57e91f7ab9435947482f7d8
commit-date: 2020-01-27
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.41.0
LLVM version: 9.0
